citeinfo.title: SURFICIAL_GEOL_MM49_IN: Quaternary Geologic Map of Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:500,000, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit:
IGS Inventory Bar Code Number 11000042
This shapefile was derived from a preexisting published paper map: Gray, H. H., 1989, Quaternary Geologic Map of Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 49.

descript.abstract: SURFICIAL_GEOL_MM49_IN is a polygon shapefile that shows surficial geology in Indiana at a scale of 1:500,000. The mapped units include textural assemblages of quaternary sediments and bedrock lithologies.
descript.purpose: SURFICIAL_GEOL_MM49_IN was derived from a coverage named "SURF_GEO500." SURF_GEO500 was created to provide a digital coverage of the surficial geology of the state of Indiana, suitable for use in a GIS, from a preexisting paper map (Gray, H.H., 1989, Quaternary Geologic Map of Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 49).

attracc.attraccr:
The following note appears on the published source map (Gray, 1989): This map was prepared using data from many sources, among the most important being earlier geologic work of Frank Leverett, C. A. Malott, W. D. Thornbury, W. J. Wayne, A. F. Schneider, A. M. Gooding, and G. H. Johnson. These were supplemented by field investigations, soils maps, and drilling data. Many of the concepts and interpretations used in the mapping have evolved through discussions with N. K. Bleuer, G. S. Fraser, and J. R. Hill. Geologic assistance by J. J. Johnson, D. P. Brewester, W. E. Nellist, D. A. Heidt, A. W. Bottum, and D. K. Spaulding. Drafted by Roger L. Purcell and assisted by Lori A. Zinn.
Tests for attribute consistency were performed by IGS personnel: Values of each field were checked, using the QueryBuilder Tool in Arcview. (a) Completeness of values were verified. - All attribute values in the shapefile were confirmed to be present on the paper source map. - No values were left blank, unless appropriate. (b) Validity of values was verified. - All values were checked for spelling and capitalization. (c) Relationships between fields symbol and description were created with a database join.

dataqual.logic: Arc/Info polygon topology is present. Checks for dangling nodes and sliver polygons have been performed by IGS staff in ESRI ArcInfo (v 8.1)
dataqual.complete: The digital shapefile was derived with minor modifications from a preexisting published paper map (Gray, 1989) and is assumed to embody the same definitions and generalizations as were used in the creation of the published map.

horizpa.horizpar: No records exist regarding horizontal positional accuracy of this shapefile. The coordinates used in georeferencing SURF_GEO500 were derived from the same Mylar separate (1:500,000 -scale) as the geologic polygons. The following note appears on the published source map (Gray, 1989): "Base modified from U.S. Geological Survey Base Map of Indiana, 1973 edition." No quantitative tests were performed.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy of the published paper source map is unknown. Vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of SURF_GEO500. No quantitative tests were performed.

srcinfo.srccontr: The lines of this shapefile were derived by vectorization of the source Mylar separate.
The attributes of this shapefile were derived by comparison with the attributes of the source paper map and the lines obtained by vectorization of the source Mylar separate.

procstep.procdesc: The Mylar separate that had been used in the publication of Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 49 was acquired. The Mylar separate, which is on file with the Technology Transfer Section of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS), was then scanned by IGS personnel, using a color wide-bed scanner, to a digital raster image. The raster image was vectorized, using ESRI ArcInfo ArcTools (v 8.0.1). The vector data was georeferenced to UTM Zone 16, NAD83. The polygon coverage, named "SURF_GEO500," was then attributed, using the same stratigraphic designations that appear on Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 49.
procstep.srcused: Indiana Geological Survey MM49 (Mylar and paper map)

procstep.procdesc: The original coverage, SURF_GEO500, was clipped to another coverage named "INCLP83," a boundary coverage for the State of Indiana (compiled at a scale of 1:24,000). Since SURF_GEO500 and INCLP83 boundaries did not coincide perfectly with one another, some polygons along the state boundary were either slightly truncated or slightly extended to the new boundary. In every case, the modifications were minor. The resulting shapefile was named "SURFICIAL_GEOL_MM49_IN."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Symbol designations derived from Miscellaneous Map 49.
Geologic Age of Deposits (as related to Quaternary Geology)
Generalized depositional association for Quaternary units

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
